intro: Hagsatera rosilloi, commonly known as the Rosillo's hagsatera, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small, clustered, and exhibit a range of colors from white to pale pink. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Hagsatera rosilloi is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
